result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Michael Ott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent Michael Ott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vincent Michael Ott was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500), Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant has 9 days sentence credit in the event probation is revoked.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: To be paid through Clerk of Courts Office as a condition of probation.
To be paid through Clerk of Courts Office as a condition of probation.
Defendant to undergo treatment and counseling agent deems appropriate.

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defefendant to pay supervision fees through probation as determined by agent. 

  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Green County Jail Office at (608) 328-9598 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.  The Jail Office hours are 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. Monday - Friday.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the Judgment of Conviction documenting a DNA Surcharge.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52
